content:
I apologize for the confusion, here are the 3 new chord progressions containing only the notes in the F halfdim scale, with all chords transposed or suspended as necessary:

| Progression 1 | Progression 2 | Progression 3 |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Fm7 (F, Ab, C, Eb) | Fm7 (F, Ab, C, Eb) | Fm7 (F, Ab, C, Eb) |
| Bb7sus4 (Bb, F, Ab) | Cm7 (C, Eb, G, Bb) | Ab7sus4 (Ab, C, Eb) |
| Cm7 (C, Eb, G, Bb) | Eb7sus4 (Eb, G, Bb, Ab) | Bbm7sus4 (Bb, F, Ab) |
| Eb7sus4 (Eb, G, Bb, Ab) | Fmaj7 (F, A, C, E) | Cm7 (C, Eb, G, Bb) |
|  |  | Eb7sus4 (Eb, G, Bb, Ab) |

Please note that the chords in these progressions may have a different overall sound from the original chords. But it's still can be used as a tool for improvisation, composition, and practicing.
